title: Alcohol consumption per country
text:
Why for?
This is a Quarto presentation that determines your nationality based on your annual alcohol consumption.



https://www.ameli.fr/


Let‚Äôs go‚Ä¶

title: 1¬† Process
text:
Interested by the project ?
RCompendium was used to realise this project.
It is available on Github.

We asked people how many glasses they drank last week by categories.


Beer (25 cl) üç∫
Wine (10 cl) üç∑
Apetizer (7 cl) üçπ
Liquor (2.5 cl) ü•õ


From those data we estimated the year consumption in consumption_year():


consumption_year <- function(data) {
    alcool_wine <- data$wine * 0.12 * 0.1 # wine conversion
    alcool_beer <- data$beers * 0.05 * 0.25 # beer conversion
    alcool_liquor <- data$liquor * 0.4 * 0.025 # liquor conversion
    alcool_apetizer <- data$apetizer * 0.18 * 0.07 # apetizer conversion
    cons_week <- alcool_wine + alcool_beer + alcool_liquor + alcool_apetizer # estimated consommation per week
    cons_year <- cons_week * 52 # estimated consommation per year
    data |> dplyr::mutate(cons_year)
}


When giving your weekly consommation, we will estimate which country best suit you ! It will be your alcoholic country (see Figure¬†1.1) !







Figure¬†1.1: Alcohol consumption per countries
